stem: A 62-year-old man is being treated for suspected infective endocarditis. His blood cultures have revealed Streptococcus bovis. What is the most appropriate investigation considering the results?
disc:
Group D streptococci (Streptococcus bovis/Streptococcus equinus complex) are gram-positive cocci that can cause bacteremia and infective endocarditis in adults. 

Infections with these organisms and their association with colonic neoplasms are well described. They may be isolated in up to 50% of patients with colorectal cancer.

Therefore, a colonoscopy is essential in excluding a colorectal neoplasm in this patient.
